Posts.Title: 2 weeks post Surgery

Posts.Content: This coming Tuesday will be 6 weeks post surgery. So far everything is going as expected and as discussed with the Doc pre surgery. I'm taking 1 Sildenafil 20 mg daily and 2 stool softeners daily. No other meds. Incontinence I guess really never occurred but I didn't know what to expect or how to define it. I have been 100 % dry at night since catheter removal, which is now just shy of 5 weeks. Thats the question the Doc and Nurses asked. Not about the leaking. Am I dry at night. I am not certain if leaking is called incontinence, maybe it is. I have a small amount of leaking when up and around but even thats getting better with more control each day. The kegels really help with this, it's like I have to retrain myself when getting up from sitting or walking around etc. I was hopeful that this week I would give up the Depends but I think I'll go another week, I know I'm close. I also don't want to get in the habit of depending on DEPENDS . They serve their purpose though. I would like to gain just a bit more walking around leaking control. I'm very close to briefs with a pad. I'm told that this can take a few months to really improve. My incisions for all practical purposes are healed. I'm cleared for physical activities but also told to be cautious. No pains , no tugging or pulling of the incisions. If I didn't know any better it's like the surgery never happened. BM's are 100% regular and I am on a 2 to 3 hour window of pee'ing. I can hold it no problem . I wish the 2 or 3 hours was 4 or 5 hours, I am told that this will take time. ED, I have not addressed this yet but I do know something is happening down there, I feel things happening . Not sure what, but something . Before the Surgery the Doc advised us of what to expect POST surgery for me, my circumstances. So far it's pretty much exactly what he said. I am still walking 1/2 to 1 mile each day and we have indeed changed our daily eating habits at home, very limited snacks and very limited carb side dishes, some meals no carb sides at all. I'm drinking water near 95% of the time now,extremely limited soft drinks and only two cups of coffee each morning. I dropped 13 lbs before the surgery , I wasn't more than 15 or 20 lbs overweight anyway, but dropping the weight I can say i really feel much better overall. Maybe another 5 pounds will be the goal. When all this began I weighed 188 , I'm 5'8". I would like to see 170 as my normal weight. My next update will not be until beginning of March when I get my 1st PSA post surgery results. Until then, everyone be safe, stay calm, stay the course . Follow the Docs orders, select a treatment that best fits your life, don't look back , don't second guess. The entire point of each of the treatments is exactly the same. I am a part time musician and last week I resumed my regular gig schedule, I had no issues going to the gig, handling my gear or during the gig. I went to the restroom before and after the gig as I typically would do and all was well. I had no "Uh Oh" moments during the show. Post OP Life has returned. It's good to be back. Happy New year ! t
Posts.Signature: DOB 1948 good overall health, non smoker, non drinker. Active with physicals, colonoscopy's and PSA testing ( urologist). Over the last 10 year period my PSA has risen gradually from 1.8 to a recent 6.4 with the most drastic change over the last 18 months, 3.8 to 6.4. I also had BPH . Colonoscopy's have all been clear. Also not overweight by more than maybe 20 pounds. No other nagging health history. Biopsy 9/18/2017 12 cores, 10 negative, 2 positive #1 grade group 1 / 3+3=6 1.7 cm, 10%, involving 1 core #2 grade group 4 / 4+4=8 2 cm, 15%, involving 1 core 10 remaining cores benign RALP 11-21-17 2 nights in Hospital, no real pain, mild discomfort. Post Op Lab report everything clear Post Op PT2 score, G8 organ confined. 11 nymph nodes benign Bladder neck and surrounding tissue benign 3 months post op, 100% dry day and night ED Injections ,@ .2 TRIMIX, so far so good. Zero PSA March 1, 2018 First PSA since surgery

Posts.Title: Day five, post RALP

Age.Phrase: heart attack at 75  I'm 69  if I meet or exceed

DoctorRecommended.Sample: Learning that you have a single G7 has a great deal to do with the type of treatment you select, especially at your age. It suggests CONFINED which is also a primary reason why many URO's would recommend surgery....As stated above, a POST surgery report would certainly add some perspective. Did your Docs recommend additional treatments , if so why ?...Before the Surgery the Doc advised us of what to expect POST surgery for me, my circumstances. So far it's pretty much exactly what he said....Not sure what, but something . Before the Surgery the Doc advised us of what to expect POST surgery for me, my circumstances....The surgeon greeted me at 5:10 pm and told me that my husband tolerated the surgery very well and while the final pathology report (due out on Monday) should confirm his diagnosis he saw nothing that would suggest that the cancer spread outside of the prostate and feels good that it remained contained. He also downgraded one of his positive cancer spots from an 8 to a 7. My husband was moved from recovery to his room within 2 hours....1:00 in the afternoon. The surgeon greeted me at 5:10 pm and told me that my husband tolerated the surgery very well and while the final pathology report (due out on Monday) should confirm his diagnosis he saw nothing that would suggest that the cancer spread outside of the prostate and feels good that it remained contained....I also was recommended to just use the ONE Foley bag, which is what we will do, they gave me a smaller one but I have no plans to use it. The Dr told me that the bag and catheter was what he termed, my life line to the surgery , treat it all with the utmost care....It suggests CONFINED which is also a primary reason why many URO's would recommend surgery. The ultimate goal is Cancer free....I am now just over 5 months post surgery. Typically a Doc may recommend taking 20 MG/ Day of Sildenafil, which I have been taking since early Nov last year....
